greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of Hamiltonian labeled n-vertex graphs with loops.
comment: A graph is Hamiltonian if it contains a cycle passing through every vertex exactly once.
xref: The directed case is A326204 (with loops) or A326219 (without loops).
Graphs with loops not containing a Hamiltonian cycle are A326239.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 17 2019
